column4: Squawk-> i guess you can modify the initrd image to give you more waiting time
surely all required modules just get loaded as and when, dynamicaly as needed or during boot?

thats booting for a usb disk, which could be bios related. Im trying to use a usb keyboard with a normal install. The problem I suspect is a module not loaded/compiled, but with no keyboard I cant see how I can load it
if your booting from a usb disk then the driver has to load before the OS. Im trying to use a usb keyboard under ubuntu, so the OS is loaded
even if you are right, how would I alter it? Given that I can't access ubuntu, since no keyboard?
actualy hadnt considered that, but is an sshd server started by default?
I can only guess at what configuration it has regarding ip addresses, since its a clean install and I have never booted it

im installing ubuntu so I can cehck it out, see whats running by default, whats not, what needs configuring etc. I have good working knowledge of linux (gentoo mostly). But if I cant get into it once...
will have a go now, but I doubt sshd started by default in normal install?
iptables is a set of userspace tools for netfilter, so it can be
iptables is a set of userspace tools that control netfilter. They are nothing to do with the kernel, all you enable in kernel is netfilter
its ok though, I figured out how to load iptables rules at boot
quite enjoying using ubuntu, making me think about things rather than just knowing where stuff is in gentoo. Probably make me much more rounded
I meant if he has a dhcp server running, not if he has a client on hte livecd
yeah sounds about right, im guessing as soneil said its probably something like firestarter rather than a script
